intro: Epilobium repandum, commonly known as willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and roadsides. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, ovate leaves that have serrated edges. Its showy flowers are pink to reddish, with five petals, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Epilobium repandum is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is known for its ecological importance as a food source for various insects and birds.
